snippet: The body of Stephen Rakes, who said he was an extortion victim of James (Whitey) Bulger, was found in Lincoln, Mass., the authorities said.
abstract: Massachusetts authorities say body of Stephen Rakes, man who said he was an extortion victim of James (Whitey) Bulger and wanted to testify at his trial, is found in Lincoln, Mass, but there is no evidence of foul play; Bulger's one-time crime partner Stephen Flemmi begins testimony for the prosecution.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood contributed reporting from Boston, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: The body of Stephen Rakes, who said he was an extortion victim of James (Whitey) Bulger, was found in Lincoln, Mass., the authorities said.

headline.main: A Death Stokes Memories in Boston of Bulger’s Gang
headline.print_headline: A Death Stokes Memories in Boston of Bulger’s Gang
